title.narrative: IR 3.3 CHILD PROTECTION & J4C SYSTEMS

description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 3.3 Child Protection & J4C SystemsNational and sub-national child protection/OVC/JLOS response system that ensures protection, care, support and safeguards for children harmed or at risk of violence are strengthened., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Data And Child Protection, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: PCR3 Keep Children SafeChildren's rights to protection are respected, protected and fulfilled in all private and public spaces.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 3.3 Child Protection & J4C SystemsNational and sub-national child protection/OVC/JLOS response system that ensuresprotection, care, support and safeguards for children harmed or at risk of violence are strengthened.
OVC Identification and registration system using 3 factor criteria, field tested in 32 districts by 2012 and criteria approved by Health, Education, JLOS and MoLG by 2014 for sustainable operation

actual.value: 2015:32 districts(100%) 291 sub counties using three factor criteria have linked 743,450 OVC to social protection services.

title.narrative: Number of districts with a mechanism in place to collect data on victims of violence

actual.value: 2015:40 districts have a mechanism to collect data on VAC

title.narrative: % Of districts implementing at least one prevention of violence against children activity

actual.value: 2015:20 districts are implementing one activity of VAC

title.narrative: % of districts that have programme in place aimed to protect and respond to violence against children in schools

actual.value: 2015:38 districts have a programme in place aimed to protect and respond to VAC in schools.

title.narrative: Number of District Coordination Committees (DCCs) applying child friendly and gender responsive procedures for children who come into contact with the law as victims, witnesses, alleged offenders or who require care, custody or protection .

actual.value: 2015:30 DCC are implementing Child friendly J4C action Plans resulting in 820 children diverted, 1800 cases disposed,54 inspections resulting in removal of children from prisons implementing J4C child friendly action plans .

title.narrative: Availability of a strategy for preventing and responding to violence against children

target.value: 2015:National Action Plan and Strategy on Violence against Children in school

actual.value: 2015:National Action Plan /Strategy to address VACIS has been disseminated to key Ministries and functionaries .

title.narrative: National Child Helpline for reporting cases of VAC and for referring them to service providers is functional all over Uganda by 2012,

target.value: 2015:100%VACcases reported to Child Helpline fwere referred to service providers.

actual.value: 2015:100% (2718) of cases reported to CHL were provided with information and counselling. Out of 2718, 1393 (51%) were categorized as acute and referred to appropriate service providers, 39% of these were closed by October 2015, while 62% are on-going.
